an3.42:4.1: “There are three grounds, mendicants, by which a person with faith and confidence can be known.
an3.42:4.3: They like to see ethical people. They like to hear the true teaching. And they live at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.
an3.42:4.4: These are the three grounds by which a person with faith and confidence can be known.
an3.42:5.1: They like to see ethical people;
an3.42:5.2: they want to hear the true teaching;
an3.42:5.3: they’ve driven out the stain of stinginess:
an3.42:5.4: that’s who’s called a person of faith.”
